content.description: Start by climbing up low angle rock with side pulls and pockets to a horizontal break. the top section of vertical wall has technical movement using a mono and pockets and finishes on a few steep juggy moves.
content.location: The route to the right of Melange

content.description: Great moderate! This one consists of mostly big moves on great jugs. The hardest part is lower down on the route, and then eases once you get established with your feet in the big huecos.
content.location: From "Bullet For Mr. Ducky", Head down hill (lookers right) an estimated 5 min walk through trees to nice clean section of rock called The Hideout. This is the first route you come to in the area that is on the darker slab where the rock quality gets good.

content.description: Start in corner and quickly head left through solid monos and two finger pockets. Consistent and sequencial climbing to a pumpy finish.
content.location: From "Bullet For Mr. Ducky", Head down hill (lookers right) an estimated 5 min walk through trees to nice clean section of rock called The Hideout. Sweetwater Saloon is located a few feet to the right of Bicameral Mind.

content.description: Climb monos, two finger pockets and edges on a left leaning scoop. Choose between many variation of poor holds and bad feet to a steepening finish.
content.location: Just to the right of Sweetwater Saloon

content.description: Bouldery start to some unique climbing on crazy natural holds. Clip the anchors below the overhang.
content.location: Sandworm is located to the right of Hop Along Cassidy and to the left of a chimney. Â Its located on the center of the clean face.

content.description:
Pitch 1 (5.8) follow the crack to the anchors where the crack disappears. the crux is finding the holds that are hard to see. (4 bolts to an anchor)

Pitch 2 (5.12-) the second pitch starts with the crux pulling the bulge. A choice of a huge move or thin pockets get you past the bulge to a jug. The climbing eases up to some unique 11- moves to the finish. (4 bolts to an anchor)
content.protection: 8 total bolts to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: Climb is located on the arete located to the lookers right of "The Sandworm"

content.description: Hopalong Cassidy is a nice easier route in the area that climbs the prowl up small dishes and crimps. It gets a little steeper up top to clip the chains, but the holds are good!
content.protection: 5 Bolts to rings. Well protected for a new leader.
content.location: From "Bullet For Mr. Ducky", Head down hill (lookers right) an estimated 5 min walk through trees to nice clean section of rock called The Hideout. This one is the slabby prowl that starts just right of a gully.

content.description: This climb has a variety of styles. Start by powering through side pulls, crimps, and pockets to a delicate slab and finishing on a fun pocketed bulge on great blackish stone. The finish has a great view of the winds!
content.location: Far right route on the buttress.

content.description: A good warm up for the area. Follow the juggy flake up 3 bolts to a tricky to read crux that involves transferring out onto the face. Make a few long moves, then it is jugs to the top!
content.location: From "Bullet For Mr. Ducky", Head down hill (lookers right) an estimated 5 min walk through trees to nice clean section of rock called The Hideout. This one follows the obvious flake left of the black bulge.

content.description:
One of the best in the area! "Bicameral Mind" features some really cool moves on bullet stone, it is well protected and a must do for the area along with "Sweetwater Saloon". Easy start up the flake to some really long moves on decent pockets. This route is pretty continuous featuring some long cross moves on some sinker 2 finger pockets. It's not over until you are over the bulge!

It is really easy to hang draws on this while lowering from the 5.10 to the left.
content.location: From "Bullet For Mr. Ducky", Head down hill (lookers right) an estimated 5 min walk through trees to nice clean section of rock called The Hideout. This is the obvious black overhanging bulge on bullet stone.
